item.title: Adult education programs in limbo as Trump administration withholds grant funds
item.description: The Trump administration is withholding $715 million for adult funding nationwide. This has left programs that serve over a million students a year scrambling for answers.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is withholding $715 million for adult funding nationwide. This has left programs that serve over a million students a year scrambling for answers.

item.title: Medicaid's many different names may cause confusion about who's losing coverage
item.description: Medicaid programs go by so many different names across the country that advocates and experts warn people may not know they're losing their coverage until it's too late.
item.content:encoded: Medicaid programs go by so many different names across the country that advocates and experts warn people may not know they're losing their coverage until it's too late.

item.title: Trump says ceasefire deal is near as Israeli strikes kill 138 Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: More than 60 of those killed were waiting for aid, according to Palestinian health officials. President Trump said Friday that talks over a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas are at a crucial stage.

item.title: President Trump says he wants to stage UFC fight on White House grounds
item.description: President Trump has announced that an Ultimate Fighting Championship bout will be held on the grounds of the White House next year, one of many events to be held to celebrate America's 250th birthday.

item.description: Russian missiles and drones hammered Kyiv in an overnight attack, the largest aerial assault on the Ukrainian capital since the war began more than three years ago.

item.title: 'Antagonized for being Hispanic': Growing claims of racial profiling in LA raids
item.description: Immigration agents are raiding known hubs for Latino workers: day laborer gathering spots, street vendor corners and car washes. Legal advocacy groups say their tactics are unconstitutional.

item.title: States may meet federal deadline on new Colorado River water-sharing deal
item.description: About 40 million people rely on the Colorado River for drinking water. It also irrigates agricultural fields. It's also shrinking. Now, states might agree on a potential deal on sharing the river.
